review: I only had hookah and drinks so I do not have any notes on the food.I came here for Kwanzaa Crawl and I had a wonderful time. The drinks from the price menu were pretty basic but they tasted good. The hookah was set up quickly and correctly. Overall, the restaurant was clean and the staff was working hard to make sure all of the patrons were taken care of. I will definitely be back.

Dope lil spot. The drinks were strong & the food was pretty good. The sliders are honestly bomb, so definitely recommend those. The hookah is great! You have to get the ice hose & the alcohol in the bottom for a top tier experience. It's a little pricey, but the music was good & so were the vibes. I'll definitely come back to support this Black Owned spot next time I'm in Harlem.

There were so many things wrong with my visit that I doubt you have enough time to read it. Long story short.Before even walking in was met with unprofessionalism, should of been my red flag. I spent a lot of money in this establishment and to be treated by everyone that works here as an inconvenience is wild! I will not find myself in here ever again. My advice support a business that will appreciate you as a patron.

I visit NY often, I live in Florida. My brother took me here for the first time in June. This place is awesome. The music, wings and Henny Punch! Oh! And not to mention the Hookah of course! I returned to NY in August and didn't know where to go it was pretty late like 2am by the time I decided to go out I wasn't far from here so I stopped by. I didn't get there in time to get the wings actually was only 8 mins after kitchen closed so I enjoyed a nice margarita and the music of course. Next time I will be sure to get there on time for wings! Great place and atmosphere.

We had a nice time here. Food was filling but just ok. Hookah  was good on service, flavors were abundant but couldnt taste it that much.Bathroom was nice, had 2.Vibe was great, seating was nice.Servers were so nice and workers are friendly.I felt welcomed.10/10
I enjoyed Harlem Hookah and the vibe. I would suggest just to go for drinks. The sangria was nasty in my opinion, so I wouldn't get that again. I would return for a stop after dinner or brunch.

I've been in the past pre-Covid and I can say the environment now is definitely different. Luckily my group of 3 made reservations earlier and were seated pretty quickly but there were several groups waiting outside hoping to get a seat when available. The music is pretty decent but it doesn't make up for the lackluster service. We waited awhile before anyone came to our table so we could place our drink and food order. The server did make a suggestion for the hookah which we opted for. There wasn't too much of a wait after ordering before getting our food, not anything spectacular but it was decent enough. The table next to us ended up leaving due to issues with their hookah and not having it addressed properly and I don't blame them. Ehhh not sure if I'll find myself back here again anytime soon.

....here we go. So my bestfriend and I were in town for a weekend trip and we wanted to checkout Harlem Hookah so we decided to go. When we arrived we had to stand outside in "a line" no one was out there but us waiting but okay. So we waited outside for about 40/45 mins (which yes in hindsight should've been a  flag but we really wanted to try it out). After being given a small table and told we have a strict 90min limit we decided to make the most of it and order the triple H drink and a hookah. So the drink was fine--my friend thought it tasted like juice. Which I agree it wasn't strong and wasn't worth $17 but I digress.Let's get to the hookah--the specialty of the venue. We received our hookah and the end of the hose was broken. I asked our server about it in hopes of getting a replacement one that was in better shape and not broken. To no avail. I was told "oh they all look like that"Well okay then. They're charging top tier prices for subpar hookahs with raggedy equipment. Then when our hookah wasn't pulling properly we realized the spring around the hose was broke so they replaced the hose with another one (also had a broken end) (see pics below). On topppppp of that, they charged us $10 extra--so $55 at this point because we wanted blueberry, watermelon, mint. The hookah guy was very nice and tried to fix it but at this point we were at the end of the road.Long story short we decided to get the check and pay for our drinks and go on our way. Our Mariyah-Lynn look alike server tried to force us to pay for the hookah saying we had it for a long time. when in reality it wasn't working because Of their faulty equipment. After some back and forth the manager agreed to remove it. Save your money and time and go elsewhere.Not worth the wait and inside is tiny. Front security was really nice though. But never again.Also looked at their health code violations on here and eek. Glad I didn't order food.

My friend and I headed here after eating at Ricardo's on Xmas Eve. HH happened to be the closest hookah bar and we trekked about thirty mins to this spot. We were seated quickly and handed a drink/hookah menu. We got the bubblegum which was good but eventually the owner and his friend came over and changed our hookah to a blueberry mint blend I think and it was amazing. The music and vibes are great at the place, the employees were also very cool as well. I will def be visiting this spot if I'm in the area.

The music will have you bumpin' just enough to look passed the unwelcoming and a bit harsh customer service of the staff! Their menu is limited so if you're looking for brunch or an actual meal, this may not be the spot for you. The food/appetizers were not as good as I had hoped to be honest. My friends had the shrimp tacos because they don't eat meat and that was the only real option for them. They didn't like it at all and mentioned that it was very bland. They ended up not even finishing it. However, I will say that the French fries were pretty good. Hot and fresh, just how I like it! I'd definitely recommend getting the hookah with the ice hose. The regular one wasnt as good.

This place is insane it's Sunday and after waiting in line for about 40 minutes while I watched a 4 top a 2 top and a 3 top available!! We finally got seated only for the server to walk past us 3 times . I'm currently here and we've been sitting for about 12 minutes she has not taken our order or brought us any water . Shes taken so long that I was able to go to the deli and grab a bottle of water ( check photo ) before our water finally came to the table . This is horrible! I am a general manager at a restaurant and I don't know wtf is going on here but you need to hire new employees ASAP I don't think you guys understand the concept of turning tables over or guest service . As I finish this I'm still waiting for a server to find the time to take my order

This place is horrible. I'm not even going to waste time writing another review. I'll just post the screenshots from the review I previously wrote and the disgusting response I got from the general manager who I see was a little calmer in here with her response. Save your time and your money on their wack reservation policy and just go to Ricardos Steakhouse in Harlem. I believe they have hookah. But if not ,The food is great and their customer service is an example of how Harlem Hookah should operate.

I recently went on Saturday before the busy rush. Our waitress took our order and never came back to table. We had to ask Hookah to get her to order more food. I wasn't given napkins with my food. Also had to ask.  Food was ordered as well as 2 Hookahs . After 2hours we're up we were told to be ready to leave as they had people waiting. We asked for manager and ... low and be hood our Waite was the manager. We were told because it was so busy is there reason for lack of service. That's never an excuse. An apology ... not needed but some kinda of compensation should have been made. I told 2 other friends about experience and they said it's alway like that . They really don't care when it's busy they do the bare minimum

I came to this establishment in the middle of the early evening on 3/26/2022 for a party of 15  which was empty by the way the staff was completely overwhelmed and decided not to serve us before this occurred a party next to us was so gracious to move to a more private setting and we decided to pay their tab as a sign of gratitude and send a round of drinks at this time we were ask to leave without ordering anything and paying a total of $200 for another table so the establishment wouldn't lose money as it was N the empty side nevertheless I personally have frequent this place and never have received such service the only two people that seemed to care about the business and not losing profit was the young gentleman with the dreads and the security officer everyone else SMH , we also tipped the waitress that didn't want to accommodate us

came here for happy hour every wednesday and thursday 6-12am the atmosphere is so much better super chill and no ones here so definitely come if you just want to smoke hookah alone or with a friend is warm and quiet rather than the loud crazy atmosphere during the summer or weekends you will find either no one or 1 or 2 people besides hookah is $35 rather than $65 and up.

When I found out that I this lounge was black owned, I was excited to patronize it. Overall it was lit vibe, good music and a cute atmosphere. Cons: We didn't have a reservation so we had to wait like 45 minutes to be seated, we were a party of 5. Once we were seated around midnight, they only had select food options available, crab cakes, sliders and fries. All food options were okay but the sauce that came with the crab cakes was good.Pros: Hookah was nice and strong, we had mango mint. The drinks?? The henny punch tasted like straight alcohol so we loved it lol. Sophia our server was so sweet and even though it was packed in there she was attentive to our table.Overall, this is a great spot for hookah, drinks and good vibes. Would definitely come again
Best hookah spot... the food is amazing right along with the hookah.. i don't drink so i can't tell you about the drinks but over all a beautiful calm spot

Came here for the first time on Thursday January 6, 2022. It was a nice mature crowd, music was mellow where you could hear it and still have a conversation. The staff were very attentive and polite. Constantly checking on you. The food was decent, had to send wings back to be cooked well done but when it Came back, it was delicious. Spinach artichoke dip was tasty but tortillas were a bit salty. Chicken quesadilla were good. Drinks were just right, not too strong. I had one rum punch and one henny punch and I felt nice but not drunk/intoxicated. No hangovers the next day. The hookah was strong and it lasted a long time. Hookah was refilled once totaling $35. For 3 people with 2 orders of Buffalo wings, 2 orders of spinach artichoke dip, one order of chicken quesadilla, 3 drinks, the total bill was $145 plus $35 for hookah. COVID cards and Id are checked at the door18% gratuity includedI will return soon!!!!!

Made a reservation that my sister PAID for and they gave up my sisters table because we were 10mins late and they have a 15min grace period. Then the owner was not letting us come in. Like common it's my sisters birthday. Not only did she cry but then he got  "his" people's inside who took OUR table and refused to speak to us cause he was too busy smoking hookah with them. Listen, just know that if you reserve a table they might just give it up. After almost an hour we get a table. The owner also gave us stank faces. And the owner is busy in her getting high off the hookah with his customers wattttccchhh outtttt! They unprofessional af in there. Not to mention they took forever to give us a waitress. Not the mention they also couldn't give us a refund for the reservation we paid for if we decided to leave before them taking forever to seat us.

I love coming to Harlem hookah, it's like family away from home. My girls Justiana and Sophia be holding it down, my fave bartenders Kelvin and Q always makes the best drinks. Couldn't think of a more welcoming place in my fave borough .
Definitely overpriced hookah, but if you're looking for a place in Harlem with good music, cocktails, and aesthetic, go for it. The wings are lit

Q is always the best bartender. He is extremely attentive and diligent. Holds great conversation with each customer while making each customer in the establishment feel as they are the only person around. He is extremely professional and gives great drink recommendations every time.

Food was amazing drinks were great hookah was fire! The owner so happened to be there while we were there and he was such a pleasure. Very personable very humble. Loved the company. 10/10 would recommend

I am really disappointed. I have been wanting to come check this place out only to receive the most disrespectful attitude. I was told that I had to wait to come inside, fine. However, I observed a young man who identified as the owner's brother allowing a party enter and essentially skip the line. I spoke to him and let him know I was next, and he stated to me that he could do whatever he wanted because he was the owner's brother. I am surprised that during these hard times, a business would turn away paying customers.

I wish i can give this place a half of star. This place is very unprofessional. They have a bunch of notices on their website about you not receiving a refund for reservation cancellation but nothing on their website about bottle availability and they call you the day of your reservation to confirm if they can provide what was in your reservation notes. I had to cancel my birthday party after spending large amounts of money on set up for them to tell me "oh i dont know why it says 2-4 reservation " mean while everybody of my party of ten was supposed to buy bottles how in hell are you gonna finish a bottles of liquor in 2 hours? But never mind that because the host told me they dont even have the bottles on their list in the establishment I STRONGLY DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HORRIBLE PLACE AND I DID NOT RECEIVE A REFUND FOR MY RESERVATION DEPOSIT EVEN AFTER I WAS INCONVENIEN!!!!!!!!
Food was ok. Hookah was good but my drink was the best! The staff was super friendly and the outdoor dining was convenient and social distanced. I would be back for more drinks

Expensive but worth it, the hookah is of very good quality and the drinks are strong and delicious. The food isn't anything special.  There is always a really long wait on weekends as it's a popular place, so I'd check them out earlier in the evening or during the week

Let's start with thanks for accommodating a table of 8 during a pandemic. The waiter was great and made sure we had what was needed. Ordering food... You will get catfished, the picture of the shrimp and grits on the menu is not what you are about to receive, I was absolutely disappointed to the fullest. My group ordered eggs with their entrees but the eggs never came out and by the time we got a hold of the waiter they had already finished eating. If your short staffed admit it, it's a pandemic and we would of understood that better then given us the it will be out in 5 minutes. Drinks are good. Hookah was good.
Yes Karla and Carissa  was  very nice  I enjoy my drinks and food and the Service and the hookah was on point

Kalvin made this the best experience I could have ever imagined. He anticipated all of our needs and was so kind and respectful. Anytime he passed by our table, he made sure to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. He is a very valuable employee to this establishment and i spores I ate his attentiveness and kindness X 100. You could NEVER lose him! Kalvin, thank you so much for everything! You are appreciated! And management is great helping out staff especially on a busy Friday night!

Great spot. Hookah is great they have a wide variety of flavors to choose from for about the same price as other spots that only have mint or blueberry mint. I wasnt going to order any food at first but my server, i believe her name was Justina suggested i try the Sticky wings and they were BOMB. Justina gave us great customer service she was very nice and although seemed very busy she made sure to check on us. It was my husband's birthday, Justina also suggested that we order the Birthday Hookah, although i wasnt a fan of the liquor base, my husband loved it!!! The Hostess Demi was also very sweet and hospitable. Overall great experience. Only thing i would suggest you make a reservation because we waited over an hour to get in on a saturday night. I'll be back next time with a reservation.

The literal best place ever. Food is amazing, hookah is the best in the city, drinks are out of this world, and music is ALWAYS on point. But the best thing about Harlem Hookah is the customer service. Carla the bartender is the sweetest, most personable person ever. She treated every customer as if they were the only ones in the room; paying extra close attention to their orders ( even sending food back that wasn't up to standard before customers even saw it). That level of detail and customer- facing understanding doesn't go unnoticed. Even security for the place is amazing and respectful. This is my new favorite spot in the city!!

First time I went there was in 2019 & they let me in, the hookah was okay. Mind you, this was back when I was living in North Carolina. I've been back multiple times since & the bouncers wouldn't let me in, always came up with an excuse saying that it'll be at least an hour wait just because I'm by myself & they did the same thing to me last night. I know it's a business but at that point I ended up drivin' to Babylon Hookah Lounge.

The service was not up to par. The waitress provided the food , hookah and drinks and did not check in until We had to wave her down. She was friendly and honest But did not tend to our table as she should have. unfortunatly, the guac comes from the store and s not fresh. honestly, it should have been 5 bucks and not 12. They don't serve tea but I guess that may be expected. I wanted a hot toddy because it was cold but they couldn't make it. They don't have food that addresses Veggie or vegan focused patrons. There Is hummus as an app, but.no other food.

If you don't know the staff personally, don't bother going! We waited 40 minutes,  and when a table cleared, they called us up. As we were waiting to sit, a friend of one of the staff members, (the really thin guy with the green hair), walked up to him and i heard the staff member say, "if you can get 2 more people, u can have this table" and he pointed to the table that we were waiting on. He told the staff, "i can see if such and such can pull up". Once he said that, he told him to sit down. Then had the nerve to tell us we had to wait again for another table! At this time I was so frustrated we just left. Straight up and down B.S.! It's a damn shame they have inconsiderate staff, because now I will NEVER try to go there again, and I will ENSURE to let EVERYONE I KNOW, TO STAY THE HELL AWAY FROM HARLEM HOOKAH!IN RESPONSE TO YOUR RESPONSE:I will say it again. I came for hookah and had an unexpected wonderful time with my girlfriend. This location does a great job at staying clean (you have to wash your hands/sanitize before being seated). The entire staff was so nice, we preferred sitting at a different table and they accommodated us as soon as they could. We had the frozen margaritas which were pretty good. The hookah was great (they use coconut coals and come around changing coals & checking on it), we had the peach and mint with ice hose. We got the sticky wings - SO GOOD! The waitress gave me so many options to fit what i like. Music was good, overall super chill vibe. Some little facts: there was a long wait for other groups starting around 4pm as they don't have too many tables outside, but we came around 3pm on a Sunday and were seated right away. There's a 2hr seating limit. They don't take reservations at the moment. Gratuity is factored in with the check. Everyone leaving negative reviews based off of wait time ... it's COVID ‍ they're doing what they can with limited space. 100% coming back!

November 9, 2019 my 2friends and I visited Harlem Hookah. This was my 3rd time here and I didn't expect to receive horrible service because the other times were good minus the lack of staffing. Let's start out with Initial seats. We were sat at the 3rd table which was too close to the door for me. I asked to be moved and was told there was no seats to be moved to. They only had seats for 2 people but there was 3 people in my party and then the host walked away. We asked the waiter whom said she would ask the host. I did some investigation my self and noticed seats were reserved for a big party which would have been understandable had we been given that response. I took a look and saw tables for 2 that had previously sat 3 people and people walked  and filled the other tables. I went back to my seat and a few minutes later the host said she had a corner table that was meant for 2 but she could sit us there if we didn't mind. We were fine with that so we moved to a corner booth. We started having a good time, talking and taking pictures. We all settled down and then I saw a roach.. yess I said it. There was an adult size roach crawling on the couch. I told my friend to move because it was crawling turds her.The 2 tables near us heard our commotion and started flashing their backlight on the coach and now 7people saw the roach. The host come by the table and asked us what happened because we were standing up and we all told her about the pest problem. She asked where and my friend showed her behind the coach where the roach was relaxing. The host then went and got a guy from the back who just asked us where the roach was. He may have been there to kill it or see it. But with 7customers looking to move tables he become distracted with changing everyone seat so the roach was never found. After being moved to the bar our waiter told the bartender the drinks we had been waiting and she closed out our bill at the table. When she did that I assume those drinks would have been free being that she closed out our bill and the orders were already put in. It was fairly busy and there was only ONE bartender in the restaurant so I can see how he forgot. So me and my other friends now had to reorder our drinks and wait even longer. When I went reordered the fishbowl I initially was waiting for before we had to switch tables I was told they ran out of fish bowls. I hardly seen anyone with a fish bowl so that meant they either never ordered enough to supply a high demand or they really had fishbowls and didn't want to sell that because you make make profits with single drinks. The bartender asked if I wanted anything else to drink but I didn't want to order anything else. Getting 1 fish bowl would have been better than getting 2-3drinks. (I learned this from the last time) I'm literally annoyed because I'm sitting in an establishment with no drinks, I don't want to eat from there no more, the last fish bowl was given to a table that ordered after me but since we had to move it was like I never ordered it, and we were sitting in front of the door so every time the door open the cold air would hit me so I ended up putting my jacket on.So now that I'm irritated about the whole experience and am ready to leave but my friend had ordered food. So now I'm just cracking jokes about the roach because I'm mad. The staff just cleaned the table and sat more people in that seat. The Food was taking long to come because the kitchen was backed up so we decide it's time to go. We got the bill so we could leave and not one drink was Compensated after encountering the pest problem. (I say problem because roaches are asexual. So they can reproduce on their own. And it was an adult roach) The Bill came and every drinks is on there so my friend tell the man to take off one drink because it's was free after the whole roach incident. Everything else was paid in full. After we get the bill fixed and everything squared away the Mac and cheese finally came out of the kitchen but by then it was too late. My friend already told the bartender to cancel the food and we were on our way out.I will not be going back nor will I refer this place.. I can't do the bad customer service. At first I started waiting to talk to the manger but we were hungry and I needed a drink . I, the customer shouldn't have to reach out to the manger/ assistant manger/supervisor/ or lead about a situation we could not control or fix. I shouldn't have to tell them to give some type of an apology or even a half assed apology because the staff acted like nothing happened which makes me think this is a regular occurrence. I'm completely over Harlem hookah. It's a hit or miss with this place. First time I went it was good vibes, good food and music , 2nd time I went there was one waiter, one bartender but still good vibes and music, 3rd time here and it was a complete fail.

I am utterly discontent with the service Harlem Hookah provided me, or lack there of. I ordered two desserts from the establishment one late night & upon my arrival, to my surprise, the order tickets had not been received and the desserts were not ready. I inquired about how long it'd take to prepare the order, but the chef decided he actually didn't feel inclined to making the desserts due to it being close to closing. I then pressure the establishment to either make the desserts or refund my money. After a 10 minute back and forth - I finally receive a brownie with the sundae omitted and no funnel cake fries. I am highly disappointed.

This place is nestled in Harlem and is quaint and cute. It's a good size spot with not tons of seating. The bouncer was telling us there max capacity is 72 with no standing. As such you have to wait outside...despite the inside not being terribly full - remove half a star for this. However it was only two of us so we entered quickly. The hostess was sweet and offered to move us as soon as a back table opened up as we were seated next to door. I got a Moscow mule first - gin, fresh lime and ginger beer. However I did not like it - tasted of older like and couldn't taste the ginger. Informed the server i didn't like the drink and he switched it for me to the Lenox cocktail which was good - gin, orange juice, grapefruit juice, lime juice, and salt. This was good. The hookah we got was grapefruit mint. It pulled nicely and wasn't burnt tasting. Our coals were never changed but we were only there about an hour to an hour and 15 min. But I also didn't see anyone's coals being changed - which could be a potential problem. Also removed half a star because service for our drinks was slowwwww. I mean I waited a good 15 min for my replacement drink after ordering and it took about 10 for the server to take my order for it after removing my first drink. Overall a nice small spot for hookah and drinks in Harlem.  Btw pricing Cocktails range from $12-14Hookah basic was $25 and 30-45 for exotic and liquor flavors We had no food.

If I could give them no star i would !My last week In New York ,my family wanted to spend time with me. We decided Harlem Hookah would be a great option . Due to the fact  the owners family was here my table of 7 was told we just have to wait (3hrs)  . Every other party had a 2 hour wait . If I knew this we would have left when we came . Customer service !!!! I think  a lot of business owners in NY miss that message .

So this was a must try on my list......I love the "bar" life and hookah.......for it to be a weekday the crowd and ambience was pretty nice......my friend made reservations for 8........when we arrived we were ID at the door before being allowed in.....they only accept official state ID ......for New Yorkers with the city ID will be denied entrance......it is some what small inside but very nice decor.....when I arrived the rest of my party had not arrived so I could not be seated......the majority of my party arrived 10 min.  Later and we were still missing one.....so we had to wait.....leave it to my friend to be super late and we lost our reservation.....the hostesses was real cool and told us not to worry.....she would accomadate us.....Once all my party arrived we were seated and immediately attened to....we ordered the lemon ice mixed with blue mist pinapple head hookah.....and rounds of drinks.......they have a full bar and the drinks were pure and strong.....the hookah smoked well and was real nice and smooth.......it did not burn extreamly fast so we did not require more than one refill the entire night....We also ordered food......the Mac Attack....  Spanish and artichoke dip.......Southwest eggrolls....and wings....(double order of all) all the food was on point....and while many rave about the mac and cheese I took a liking to the eggrolls....portion size was ok.......standard appetizer.......between smoking....eating.....and the litt music the time went by fast....So all in all of course I would recommend you going HOWEVER be prepared......this place is NOT CHEAP.........between drinks .....food ....and hookah for 4 ladies we spent $538.......but I am not mad about it or complaing because I  enjoyed myself......and like with many things in NYC......you pay for the experiance more than the food and drinks......and we are 4 ladies who can throw a few back and only drink  premium liquor......

I revisited this spot again for the 3rd time. It's a hot spot in Harlem because it is one of the few for OUR ppl. The music and vibes is right for people of colors even though all are welcome. My hostess Demi was everything.. she should be promoted because in Harlem with that customer service skills .. it is unseen. I am a native New York but not of Harlem and I drive because she has made the experience that more enjoyable. I invited about 8 ppl from out state to this spot and they loved it. They said they have never experience something like this in their state ranging from Seattle to Jacksonville FL. She was super accommodating. Then she introduced us to Justina who put the icing on the cake with impeccable first class love. She brought out the food timely and continued to check on us. It was a Saturday and truly wasn't expecting that. The bouncers were different then the last time I came too. They did a complete change of staff since I came a few year ago and I couldn't be happier. Since opening the service in this spot has now gone down. I mean from entering, to sitting down, the workers are not warm or welcoming. She plopped the food down in front of us and put the bill down again. That type of service behooves me because I have been to Harlem Hookah a few times and appalled at the shift in service.  Shawna came over and changed our experience. There is a level of professionalism that should be maintained at all times. My party of 5 will definitely think twice before we come back. Service was bad! Hospitality was horrible! Service and Hospitality is key to the success of a business especially in New York!

Harlem Hookah is a great afterwork or weekend vibe. It has great music, awesome crowd. Every time I enter HH, it makes my heart sing to see black working class young ppl coming together to enjoy an evening out. The drinks are strong but I like It that way. The food taste delicious, I just wish it was warmer. The few times I have supported this business, the food was lukewarm. The servers are always welcoming and providing good service. The servers are always accommodating to make sure every experience is A1.  How can I forget the hookah.... The hookahs are good as well. I wouldn't recommend spending money on the extra pineapple addition or liquor flavor hookah because it doesn't make a big difference for the money. The basic hookah will do the job. All in all, this place is a little gem in Harlem. It's great for afterwork, girls night out, fellas night out, a quick date and more. I will definitely return.

Updated review. Dropped it another star because this person decided to leave a snarky message in my inbox about using frozen fries, yet charging an outrageous price. It's one thing to have overpriced items for frozen food, but it's another when you provide bad costumer service on top of that.

Ordered the sliders and fries. It was decent, but overpriced. Especially the fries. It think they use frozen fries.They taste like the exact same type I can get from cheaper fast food places. I tried ordering one of their desserts on more than one occasion, but they're never available.
I would love to go on Caribbean night to see the vibes. I would go back for food and drinks. I don't do hookah so I can't tell you about hookah but the smoke wasn't over whelming at the time.

After sadly missing dinner with my friends, a couple of us came here to chill and hang out for a bit. As soon as we got there, the bouncer let us know that they were at capacity and wouldn't be letting anyone else inside. We were so annoyed, but started looking for another place nearby. As soon as we found someplace and started to walk away, the bouncer called over to us and let us know that some people just left and that they had 3 seats available at the bar! Look at God!I was a bit annoyed when we walked in because I didn't see why we were stopped from coming earlier. The place was not full at all, but I suppose they don't want people standing around and will only allow people in if they can be seated. The food came out so quickly I almost sent it back in fear it wasn't cooked enough, but it passed the taste test! Or maybe I was too hungry to tell the difference haha. The buffalo wings were good and the fries were nice and crispy. I had the Triple H drink, which was Henny, Henny, and some other stuff. Also, you guys, the hookah was ELITE! Nice and smooth, great flavor (we got mint and mango) and they change the coal frequently. Shoutout to the real MVP, our bartender Shelby! She was so cool and down to earth and makes amazing drinks!

This was probably one of the worst experiences in a venue EVER!!! I wanted to make reservations for a group of 8 but due to the pandemic wasn't sure I could do so and wanted to speak to someone. We spoke to the bouncer who was the only help in the situation and he explained they gave the huts up and that we would have to wait on line for a table. It seemed like every time we asked for something they were out. I literally NEVER EVER leave bad reviews and this would be my first but the utter disrespect and lack of customer service is appalling. PS when we arrived all the huts were full and the bouncer said they pulled the next person off the line to fill it.

Horrible customer service, understaffed on a Saturday afternoon and claimed that "were not usually this busy at this time". Upon entering we were never properly attended to nor greeted. Came here late one night with my girlfriend. We both got fish bowls. It was nice. The music was popping but the vibe was still chill and relax. Hookah was also good too!

I got the chance to go back a couple of weeks ago on Nov 7th. They opened indoor dining.  it was a pleasant experience. The wings are back to being delicious (fried a little extra hard- but I'm not Goldilocks). Mac and Cheese still BOMB. They took the egg rolls off of the menu completely but I respect that. Drinks are always good. I had a great time.

Before COVID this was my favorite place to go. I'm so very sad they changed most of the staff but more so the CHEF. I swear I used to ALWAYS look forward to their egg rolls and sticky wings. Like legit dreams of them... (dont judge me yall, im a picky eater so when i find something i like, i love it!)The new egg rolls have way more veggies and are just seasoned hella different. They don't really taste "Southwesty" to me. The sticky wings aren't sticky or friend hard enough, it's like a light fry and covered in a slippery sweet chili sauce. It might be okay for newcomers but as someone who has been going to HH for a couple years now, the changes are very disappointing. I haven't tasted their new mac and cheese yet (if it is new) or fries but I'm hoping that at least those did not change. The crab cakes are good though!The drinks and atmosphere are still pretty good as well. I always love the music and the vibe, some people say the hookah is too strong but it always works me. The new staff is friendly and attentive but it's kind of sad to see people you've become accustomed to leave. I'm just hella disappointed in the food. Hoping they get it together so I can get excited again about going here. I'll never give up hope and will probably try them again but I'm going to wait a while before my next attempt.

This place is a gem. Came here on a Friday night, it was actually the night going into my birthday. The place had a good amount of people but no one was on top of anyone. My friend and I say at the bar. We both were unfamiliar with Hookah but the bartender Christian was AMAZING! He gave fantastic recommendations on flavors. I think we got the blue mist mixed with Kiwi. Also the drinks were good and strong. The hookahs lasted awhile. The music and vibe was on point. Playing mostly hip hop with a mixture of Spanish and West Indian. We didn't get to try to food but the kitchen was opened really late. Everyone around us was nice and we had pleasant conversations. The music was good and the volume was not overwhelming that it drowned out conversations. It was a great chill spot to bring in my 30th. I cant wait to return.

First time coming on a Saturday and my first impression was "wow this looks like a cool place". Checked out Harlem Hookah on a humbug on a Tuesday night around 9ish.  They been open since October 1st and I have been meaning to make my way here.  We were greeted by the hostess and grabbed two seats at the bar.  The bartender handed us menus, but then it took him a little longer than expected to get back with us to take our drink order. When he finally took our order then another bartender came over to take our order again.  I am assuming maybe they were changing shifts.  Anywho I ordered a glass of Riesling($12) and my friend opted for the Red Wine Flight($16).  After looking at her flight I felt like that is what I should have went with.  I also tried the specialty cocktail called Lenox Ave, and I got it because I am a gin lover.  It was great drink but the salt was a little overpowering.  During the time I was there they apparently ran out of wine glasses and the staff was hovering over patrons for empty glasses.  For this to be a bar with wine flights they should have more than enough wine glasses, and especially on a Tuesday night.My friend ordered hookah as well, and I believe she got watermelon and mint.  I tried it once because I have a respiratory infection that would not allow me to enjoy the hookah.  The one time I did try it had a very smooth flavor which I loved.  We had people come by several times to change the coals, and they were very attentive.The establishment's decor is beautiful and has this clean and chic look to it.  The marble bar is what your eyes are immediately drawn to and also the beautiful chandlers.  The bathrooms are pretty tidy and have mirrors have the log illuminated which make great for photo ops. LOL.  This is a great place for large groups, and I recommend making reservations.  And this seems to be a popular place for people to celebrate birthdays as well.The place also serves up food and the chicken wings seemed to be popular with everyone at the bar.Overall, I can tell they are still working out a couple of kinks which is expected with any new business.  I will be back soon regardless!P.S. - They have happy hour for the month of October from 4-6pm.  Also, don't forget to check in and get 5% off :)

This place was a great little night cap and our server was very helpful. I ordered the Tripe H cocktail (Harlem Hookah Hennesey Punch) and it was great, quite the cocktail.

First of all I'm going to state some good and some bad. I found this place on yelp when I was looking for a place to celebrate my birthday dinner. Since I had more than 8 people who wanted to come I had to make a reservation. Any reservations over 8 people need a deposit for $100! You have to schedule your reservation at least a week before depending on what day you want to have it on (the weekends are very busy). I called a week in advance like the lady said and paid for me deposit. A few days later the receptionist said it didn't go through. I was able to pay over the phone the day before my reservation. Fast forward to the night of, my party of 10 became a party of 5 because everyone was running late. The lady who made my reservation (I don't know her name but she makes EVERYONE'S reservation) she was beyond rude and did not want to let us in. It was my birthday night so I just wanted to leave because we was embarrassed for standing outside. Luckily my bf spoke to the manager and she was nice enough to let us in. The manager was literally the sweetest lady and checked on me frequently throughout the night. If it wasn't for the manager I would of gave this place 1 star!! Everything is pricey and will add up so be careful. Oh and your deposit can be used once you are in there but the bill have to be together and the gratuity is 18%. My bill ended up being $149 even with the deposit already added so really it was $249! My Besttriend had a tab open and ended up paying $70 for about 4 drinks and a shot. This place is high end and NOT WORTH GOING TO.

This is a update reply to Renee the business manager: People of color have nothing to do with the establishment it, was the lack of service and water down drinks that i wasn't happy with. As a manager that was an inappropriate statement being that i am a person of color myself and support businesses own by people of color. Instead of throwing the race card you could've just taken my complaints into consideration for future customers or still give the invitation to fix it. very unprofessional.

Not worth your time or money.Reservations: We made reservations for 8pm for 8 people. 5 of us got there before the other 3 and they did not let us come and wait inside or at least let us sit and start a tab at the bar. Instead they insisted they needed the complete party of 8, in order to be let in the establishment. Please keep in mind, IT WAS  EMPTY IN THERE!! I can count on one hand how many people were there -__- so there was more than enough space to accommodate. So we waited close to 20-25 minutes outside in the cold and rain, until our friends arrived and we were seated.Drinks: Average $12-$14 water down and simple syrup drinks. pointless since you are there to get some type of buzz.Food: the food was okay, until i left and immediately got a stomachache from the food! I got the Mac attack ($15) and the Chicken Quesadilla ($12). The Chicken Quesadilla had a bland chicken taste and cheese. no pico de gallo,  no nothing. (but i guess this is expected since it isn't a Mexican restaurant). How do I know it was their food? 4 of us all got the bubble guts immediately after leaving. Service: The waitress was more concern with jamming to the music playing than servicing us correctly. We had to ask for water and other condiments since she did not bother to bring it to us from the start. I found myself having to get up and walk over to her and ask what me and my guests wanted to order. Hookah: The birthday person we were celebrating got the BIRTHDAY Hookah. SAVE YOUR MONEY! OVERPRICED! $70!! you are basically paying for the sparkler and the pineapple head smh. The flavor was "skittles" and it smells like a nasty fake candy and smoking it was even worse!Overall experience: Definitely not coming back ever. If you notice the negative reviews on yelp about Harlem Hookah, they show they do not care for their customers. They respond to negative reviews by saying "thank you" instead of apologizing and trying to correct the problem. SMH Save your money. Don't bother with this place.

On the weekends it is hard to get in if you don't have reservations. It's pretty small so that's why they are strict with who they let in. I personally don't like the fact it's so small and can't really have fun in closed in spaces. Overall the music was great, hookah is huge but super expensive.

So we had to every minute run after the staff for everything.... waited long to be served .... and the worst thing was the calamari ! The hookah was great and so the buffalo wings very tasty but ... the place is really not style the crowd and music played .... the calamari was real disappointing

So we went here Friday night & stood outside for 30-40 mins in the cold for us to over hear the host say to another party, she only has tables available for 2 sets of people at a time ( Idk what that means ) No one said anything..no one came out to tell us. We did call prior they told us it was no problem to have a party of 5We went to another spot before going to HH the owner came out & told us the place was pack and we were allowed to at least go to the bar but he at least gave us our options.I am just annoyed no one came out to speak to us. Questioning coming back.

I thought I liked this place. Ordered an Apple martini. Ok. Not once but three separate times in a row I received a glass with lip stick stains and water marks. Who wants to drink from a dirty martini glass?! I was super polite but 3 times in a row? WOW. Not to mention never was there an apology. Bonus: I never got my drink back after 3 attempts to have a sanitary beverage.  not cool. Don't waste your time.
We enjoyed this spot. The food was ok but it was Karaoke night which made the mood light and enjoyable. I'd go back.

I came here on a Saturday around 1:30am to celebrate a friends bday. My party had already been at the restaurant for about an hour. When I arrived, I was rudely told by security and a hostess to stand on line outside in the cold. I complied and didnt debate the issue. I was the only person on the line for 25mins. After 25 mins, I politely asked why exactly I couldn't go inside. His response "its our policy. The place is packed. Your party is already here and we dont allow ppl to join parties after everyone is seated." I called the birthday girl to let her know the situation. Within, 5 minutes I was allowed in the spot. I guess she spoke to the manager. The security guard and hostess seemed annoyed that the manager decided to override their decision.  Funny, when I entered the place.. it was not packed at all! Other than that ridiculous policy, the music was great, hookah was solid and the spot is cute. I didnt drink or have anything to eat. I live in Harlem and I love supporting black owned businesses but treating customers rudely and trying to act like the place is some exclusive celeb club is not cool.Not sure I will be back unless i come after work for a drink.

It's my first time here, and I was waiting outside like every other person in line to get it. We had a reservation which was good. The Maitre'd was very cordial and got us seated fairly quickly. She was also fairly nice. At this bar, they search mostly men for weapons which is reasonable. I had my hood on when I was outside because of the cold. The bouncer approached me and asked me if I had been convicted of a crime; I assumed he was joking so I said no. He then proceeded to ask me if I was a woman; I wasn't offended because I think women are great. He said he can't let "chicks with dicks" in. (I kid you not) I was shocked and I told him that was a very rude question. He said he wanted to know so he could search me and there were no surprises. This is NYC, im not trans but I felt that was incredibly rude especially in the current political climate. No one deserves to be treated like that and I don't think my friends will be returning. As someone who is an ally to women and people who identify as trans, I wouldn't advise that you visit here. Our experience was reprehensible

This place is awesome... The manager Ms. Nicole was amazing and catered to my party and needs she was very accommodating.. Our server Alaysia was fantasitic.. she was polite and very attentive.. food was great!! Buffalo wings chicken and shrimp quesadilla and the Mac and cheese was all good.. food came out perfectly hot.. also our hookah was customly made by Amirita so enjoyable... and the decor is very chic and elegant.. great place to go with a group of friends... music is pumping!!!!

Nice ambiance. The bouncers are firm but friendly. The establishment isn't terribly spacious but it is well appointed and set up in such a way it doesn't feel claustrophobic. I personally do not smoke hookah, however, the group I was with was comprised of regulars, all whom love this spot. The crab cakes were good, not Maryland Harbor style, but very tasty. The patrons were mostly in the early 20 - 30 range with a peppering of a maturer group. I would consider vibe urban hipster....LOL. Again, I don't personally smoke hookah but i'll come back for the food.

The service was not the greatest however was far from the worst.. I went there around 7:30pm in a Sunday..It was not too crowded...The hookahs are reasonably priced around $38 and they dont charge for coal refills..the drinks are strong as well...the bathroom was not the cleanness and it is unisex..just be be careful because they add GRATUITY to ALL BILLS..It was me and another person; Party of (2) and they still added gratuity automatically to the bill and almost charged me for food I didnt order...however they were quick to fix the bill; just read over your bill carefully and know that it doesnt matter how big your party is, everyone pays gratuity automatically.....lastly, music wasnt bad, DJ mixed the music pretty well...

Finally made it!!!! =D A bartender from Cove Lounge (check them out!) told me about Harlem Hookah and a friend and I tried to go that same night. Needless to say, that did not fly. It wasn't even the fact that it looked filled to the brim inside either, there was some drama at the door that we found best to avoid.I decided to finally go after work on a Friday and made a reservation for a mere one for 10:30. I arrived at 10:15 and was seated! Not sure if the ladies in the line were happy about that, but I think they were waiting on their entire party.Decor is pretty sleek, the chandeliers are a fantastic touch against the white marble. It gives the venue a sophisticated edge that I NEVER see at hookah places. I got the vanilla hookah and it was, without a shred of doubt, the smoothest hookah ever. The owners mention on HH's site, that they're avid lovers of hookah. The quality shows! Coals were always tended to and if I had the lightest hint of harshness or decrease in smoke quality, they were on it. A pal decided she wanted to come through and when I asked the host about it, it was no issue. Initially she was told that she couldn't come in, but that was only because the doorman wasn't informed. Easily solved. She loved the hookah too! We're both hookah novices (aka we choke often lol), so the smoother the better!Drinks were so-so, I got something made on the spot as a suggestion by my waitress (it was essentially a strawberry lemonade with vodka) and a cosmo. Both were lacking on terms of liquor, but one was free so hey! I got the sliders which were a bit dryer than I would have liked, but my friend got the hot wings and devoured them like they were her last meal. My server, whose name I kept forgetting but I'm so certain it was Tatiana, was THEEEEE BEEEEEEST!! Though she was busy, she was attentive and super chill! Like, I would totally ask for her again! All in all, a really fun time! Recommended!

I had a horribleeeee experience here yesterday. I got there around 7:30pm and waited on line for about 2 and a half hours. The line was barely moving. The staff allowed two groups to skip the line and seated them before my group and those who were on the line longer. The reason I waited was because the waitress made it seem as though we would be seated soon. Harlem Hookah claims to have a 2 hour max on dining, however, I witnessed multiple groups there stay past two hours. When we finally were seated around 10pm, the waitress told us we could not order food because the kitchen was closed. No one made mention of this to us and watched us wait there after we told them we came for food. The staff completely disregarded us and was rather rude. This was not my first time here and I am appalled at their lack of care and horrendous customer service.

First of I would like to say that I am a frequent customer of this establishment and have been here quite a few times since it has opened. Never had any complaints before this, Love the decor and the service and the crowd it pulls in.. The wait staff is very attentive and friendly. My last two experiences here was the absolute worse.. With a reservation I waited 45minutes (unacceptable) And not only that but the bouncer was letting others in with no reservation at all. All Awhile telling me and my party there was no tables available, But when we finally did get inside the same guys with no reservation were at table. Once I seen this me and my party was completely turned off and just ended up leaving. I'm assuming he was only letting people in that he personally knew. But it was completely unacceptable. My second experience with a reservation made also.. I was told that it was a party going on with no outsiders so me and my guest would not be able to get in. Once again disappointed, I proceeded to show my reservation confirmation after being told I couldn't have made one for this particular night. Needless to say we ended up leaving. I haven't been back here since because of these two incidents, customer service means a lot to me in any establishment I go to. And I was not pleased at all.

First off, this is a beautiful establishment. I was a little put off by a couple of things. One thing being that I was left to wait outside in the snow for the rest of my party. There was a snow storm so it wasn't extremely crowded. I thought that having me wait in the snow was a bit rude, especially since they were only excepting guest with reservations. But I didn't make a big deal out of it.  Once my party did arrive, we were seated immediately and the service was OK. We placed or drink orders to have the waitress come back 10 minutes later to ask, "what did you guys order again? I forgot". That took me by surprise because I swore she logged it into an IPad or something. Still that didn't upset me. She was sweet and attentive from there on out,  so I looked passed that. We each ordered 2 drinks. And a 2 rounds of botton shelf rum shots...We ordered a hookah with a the pineapple top and gummy bear and blue mist flavoring. We loved it.    We were a party of 4, and only 2 of us ordered food which were  2 orders of wings and the mac attack (which were not as cheesy as the IG pics). Our bill with tax and gratuity was $350-400.  A little expensive but we enjoyed ourselves. I would go back for happy hour. Hopefully it won't be as pricey. PS. The bathroom mirrors are DOPE. Check them out if you visit.
This place is a pretty chill spot. Good food, good drinks, good vibes.

My friends and I had a great experience here. I made reservations a few days before the time I planned to go for 11:45 pm which was a Saturday night. I received a call for confirmation, which I thought was cool of them to do so. We arrived about 10 minutes before our scheduled time and was seated within a few minutes. I will say the server seemed a bit pushy for us to get our drinks and order placed but maybe it was because of the two hour limit on tables. We ordered a hookah (bomb), wings and fries(bomb) and drinks (bomb) and we were in heaven! I can't forget the music (bomb)!! The vibe was very nice and it wasn't too crowded. Everyone was having their own fun! I would definitely recommend checking this lounge out and I must add that it is black owned. One of the main reasons I wanted to check it out. Visiting from Alabama and what we enjoy in lounges I will say that we really enjoyed ourselves.

Mandatory positives: gorgeous decor, good music, and I liked the crowd.Negative: my sober friend was told she was too intoxicated to drink and ended up leaving the bar in tears. Very disappointed because I live in the area and have been looking forward to visiting... Guess not.

I've been coming to Harlem hookah for many years and I have never experienced anything like this before. They were absolutely slow and unprofessional. Sophie was our waitress and then randomly switched us over to someone else that wasn't aware of our table and/needs. It took 1 hour to get my food, 1hour to get my first drink and 1 hour to get my second drink.  Then Shay(the manager) said that we had spent more than 2 hours at our table so we could not get a refill on our hookah. But then our new waitress came and told us that we can get a refill but that took another 30-40 minutes at that point I was ready to go. However, I would like to give a special shoutout to Judith for trying to remedy the situation, even though it it was too late at that point.

I saw a review for someone same day.. not to criticize her.. but place was full... not that capacity matters. Hmm.. hookah 25 is okay... decor is amazing.. elegant.. clean.. Apps and menu are pretty good.Music is mostly ganster rap with some top 40 hitsOverall place is nice and see myself coming back

Food and hookah were overall very good, the only downside was the service provided... for as long as it took to wait for a seat was as long as it took for the server to attend to our table, which seemed much longer than need be. Other than that, we would definitely return to enjoy some good food on a chill night.

Went on a Tuesday night and loved it! Happy hour was all night so drinks and appetizers were reasonably priced. I got the rum punch which was strong and delicious. DJ was good. No complaints! Will definitely be back.

My girl made reservations and brought me to this lounge. (The woman underneath this post w. the big head ) we came here with a group of 4. Walking into this establishment I was blown away by the environment. The decor was unique and set your mind into a relaxing state. The Skittles flavored Hookah was powerful, and definitely will have you choke up. The Duke game was on . The music was smooth, featuring a range of artist such as 6lack, Tory Lanez, Disclosure, Drake, & The Weeknd. The drinks were strong/flavorful, and the server was attentive to our every need. The downside of this night was the host asking us to move to the bar after an hour into our reservation. (When you have 6 people you're suppose to have 2 hours at a table). Once we moved the host gave us complimentary patron shots for the unfortunate removal. Overall I would come back to the establishment, but on a slower night than a Saturday. P.S. - They are strict on reservations and arrival time.

I came here on a Friday night to celebrate my birthday I made reservations a few days prior and I tried calling to confirm my reservation was received since I did it online but when you call it's an automated voice messaging system that responds so I left a voicemail and did not receive a call back. The day of my reservation I tried calling again left a voice mail and still so answer or call back. I arrived to be place about 30 mins after my reservation time and explained to the hostess about my reservation and that I tried calling but she told me that they gave my table away and that I wound have to wait at least an hour and a half for another table it was 11 pm at this point and I asked her to see if anything Could be done because I didn't want to bring in my birthday on the street. Finally I was able to speak to a manger and showed her proof that i tried calling and she worked her magic and got us in before 12!!!Soo ... the place is kinda small but very nice inside the waitress was very nice and attentive. We ordered the bob Marley hookah and the coquito both are amazing !! And strong !! I had the Harlem mule . We ordered some appetizers the fries were fresh ! Loved it also the quesadilla was good also. My friends ordered the sliders but I didn't try it. I would definitely go back here and arrive on time . The bouncer also told us that Friday's and Saturday's are reservations only !! FYI
Good food, but the unlimited mimosa for 2 hours is a scam. I had table of 11 people and they would only supply the table two bottles at a time, then we would have to wait over 15mins  for a refill.

This place is super fun and very classy for a hookah bar. They have a really good happy hour with good food and good priced hookah. They have a very thorough screening process for ID's and even have portable phone chargers which is super clutch since I had originally  came there cause my phone was dead ! Server was a sweetheart and hookah coals were brought often. Will be back !!

This place is amazing! Kind of upset with myself for not coming here sooner! Athough the venue isn't huge, the ambience is extraordinary. Great music, customer service, and the menu selections. The hookah they provide is strong, meaning you actually taste  the flavor and it doesn't leave that annoying itchy throat feeling like most places. The FOOD IS DELICIOUS; the Southwest Egg Rolls with Avacado Ranch dip is a must,  the Sticky wings, and Thai Sweet chilli calarmari are just as good. Looking forward to coming here again. Oh and did I mention that they have their own snap chat filter!

I really like this place. I went for hookah and drinks on a Saturday night . I got two of the Hennessy punch and it was made perfect. The place plays good music and the staff are nice. I also got the tacos as an appetizer and they were good. No complaints ! I will def. be returning !

This place was busy on a Sunday night. Now you know people have work the next day so this speaks volumes about the tranquility of this space.After coming across this hookah spot on Yelp I knew I had to go. I have gone to many hookah places but no other establishment had a classy well thought out layout like Harlem Hookah. Their staff is very attentive and they pay close attention to change the coals and to assist when needed. We had some kind of mint hookah I cannot recall the name but I do plan to return to try it again! We placed an order of their buffalo wings they were sweet and hot so tasty! I would highly recommend this hookah spot for a calm vibe.

I went with a group of four people for a reservation that we had on a Saturday night. Our reservations were set for 9:30pm, and we got there around 9:15pm. We were greeted nicely at the door and taken to our table immediately.Sitting down for the four of us, I thought that the table they placed us at a tiny bit tight, but we sat and got comfortable after a while. I ordered some calamari with sweet thai chili sauce on the side. Let me tell you America, this is the absolute BEST calamari you will ever taste in your entire existence on this earth. It is seasoned to perfection and the tenderness of it is perfect; it's not too crunch and not too chewy. It has the perfect consistency. The sweet thai chili sauce was amazing as well, especially on the calamari. I ordered a Henny Punch and another drink that I cannot remember, but they both were good. The bartender's hand was a little heavy, so although the drink prices are slightly high, you will certainly appreciate it with the amount of alcohol you get in your drinks. The hookah we got was a mix of two flavors and it was very good. The servers are constantly coming by to check and see if your coals are still fresh. They are very polite and attentive to everyone's needs. The music was perfect there if you like Hip-Hop. Perfect blend of classics along with good songs that are out now. Music isn't played too loudly to the point to where you can't hear your friends, but it is loud enough for you all to thoroughly enjoy the ambiance there. I have been back a few times since my first time and I have been nothing less than pleased every single time I've been back. Highly recommended!!

I want to like this place because I live in the neighborhood and love hookah. The owners and management need to understand that it's not okay to hold people in a line to walk  into an almost empty establishment. Drinks are weak and over priced and the food is Meh at best. Not to mention the rude staff members. I'm a pretty nice guy and don't like to patronize establishments that don't make me feel welcome. Won't be returning.

Trash ass bouncer in the front is for sure the reason people are not coming in to spend money on the establishment. Definitely did not make me want to come and spend money. I'll take my chances up the road.

I was really excited to check the place out after the pristine aesthetic showcased by their Instagram page. After arriving, I was a bit let down, the pictures looked a lot different so maybe it was just a rendering. Still a beautifully decorated space! I love the light fixtures, the bar, and table designs. Very inviting decor and ambiance. I strictly came for hookah and wine, as I had already eaten the day of my visit. The hookah was very reasonably priced and coals were changed efficiently. I wasn't at all pleased with the fact that one glass of wine is $12, I don't think I've ever paid more than $8-$10 for one glass of wine. I'm in the industry and well aware that typical wine pours are 5 ounces, at $12 per glass that's a crazy markup. My friend ordered wine by the glass, it looked more like 4 ounces. I opted for the wine flight, thinking it was a better deal; 3, what looked like 3oz pours for $16. No way I'd only do one glass lol I allowed my bartender to choose the wine for me, since Cabernet which is my Red of choice wasn't available. I was very fond of his recommendations, I had a Pinot noir, a Malbec, and a merlot. The Pinot was my favorite. Being such a new spot, I definitely sensed areas of improvement as far as operational structure and general flow of things but hopefully in time they will iron all kinks out. I definitely will be back, I'm open to giving them another shot and hopefully being able to give them a revised 5 star review.

I honestly enjoyed this place so much. The service is great, please make your reservations on time or they will have to waitlist you. Even 10 mins late can make a difference. I came with 6 girls and we split one hookah and it was enough because the hookah is strong but with a pineapple head it makes it smooth. The waitress was so fun and helpful.  All the service was great, the servers checked on us often as well. I got a patron margarita and a Hennessy side car. I would get the side car again the margarita like orange juice.

Went with some friends on a Thursday evening.  Cool spot - chill yet classy, I would say.  I ordered the sliders and the mac attack (3 ways).  I asked the waitress what the three ways were and she had no idea.  I also asked that she find out and she returned without an answer.  I decided to try it out anyway - I eat mac and cheese everywhere.  The sliders were bland and had no sauce.  The mac and cheese 3 ways were 1. mozzarella and chicken 2. basic cheddar 3. unsure of the cheese, but it had a nice crumble on top and contained shrimp.  THANK GOD I WASN'T ALLERGIC.  It's dangerous not having that listed on the menu and even more dangerous that the waitress did not know that it was in one of the macs!!!  I also had the Harlem Marg on the rocks, which is their play on a margarita. It was purely margarita mix so avoid ordering.  The service was good and the waitress was sweet.  They all need to be more educated on the menu and the food was mediocre.  I am, however, still interested in the hookah. I personally feel smoking and eating is odd, so next time - when they've been open for a bit longer - I'll give the hookah a try.

Wonderful experience, will be recommending to all who find themselves in Harlem. Tianna was our server - very lovely, sweet, attentive. All the staff are really nice actually - I didn't catch his name but the man helping us with the coals was also wonderful. It's great when people look happy in their work place! the hookah was great - double Apple had a licorice aftertaste, burned smooth and sweet. Music was great too, at the right volume. Also the place draws in an interesting crowd. I enjoyed watching the patrons at the bar - high fashion, vibrant people. Thanks Harlem Hookah!

This place is so cool!  Went in here with some friends for some drinks, and hookah!  The atmosphere in the lounge is new, modern and clean!!  They surprisingly had great food!!  The mac and cheese was really good, and the wings had some good spice to them!  Staff all friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. I'll definitely go back!

So me and a friend came to visit this place last, night which was s Saturday. We ended up going there because it was 2am, (they close at 4am) it was new and I seen a few friends mention the spot on IG, haha. Now me Personally, I'm A HOOKAH HEAD! lol I'm sorry I love hookah so the fact that this spot was close to home I was so hype, I normally would uber to Dykman in a heartbeat! And like I said I came to do hookah I wanna blow smoke clouds and the ac is just blowing the shit away lol that had me aggy as hell. --but listen I know I'm a bit of a jokester but overall this place is chill. The decor is BEAUTIFUL! it really looks nice as hell inside, I'm big on that. Really clean, the staff seemed pleasant. my waiter who was helping was really nice the whole time so their customer service I would diff give them a 10. Nearlt empty hookah lounge and they make sure they make you Wait out in the cold. Before the let u in they let u know that they only take cash and card wtf else are would you pay with. Also they let u know there is a 2 hour limit twice. What kinda service is this. Sounded almost like they prefer you DONT spend your money.

After 8 you need a reservation so make sure if you plan on visiting on the weekend you do that. That's 1.Decided to try this spot & luckily we were able to get a table. The decor is nice but the the spot is small. I love the marble tables, the chandeliers & how well lit the area was. The music was good. We were vibing & still able to hear each other talk. As a hookah lover, I was not pleased with the hookah what so ever. It was very harsh. The pull was whack. However, a very nice gentlemen came by & spoke with us offering his assistance anytime we needed but there was no saving it.  #dead...the coal is refreshed often. For food, my dude had the sticky wings that he said lacked seasoning. He wasn't too happy with them. I got the Mac attack all cheese cause i don't eat meat & im allergic to shrimp. It was good. Real cheesy so . Three cheese quesadilla was what it's supposed to be. We just got henny on the rocks so can't comment on the drinks. The shot was alittle skimpy.Overall, it's a new spot & recently opened so I'll definitely revisit for a second try. The staff was nice for the most part. My dude didn't feel like he got enough attention since he felt like the spot was small & more intimate then a typical lounge/bar.

Overall pretty nice spot. Love the decor. If you're a Hookah Smoker, you will recognize that their Hookah is HIGH QUALITY. They can definitely work on spacing but other than that .. very nice area with great urban music. Drinks and the finger food they do have is "ok" ..*KEY TIP* MAKE RESERVATIONS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHTS! It gets packed and the lines can be a long wait!

The food is horrible & taste like a child made it. The hookah & drinks are overpriced and the place is always boring. Also there's no DJ. Don't waste your money if your looking for fun spot with good food & service this is not the place!

I knocked one star off because we did have a short wait outside for a table and when we got inside there were many empty tables,  so the wait was confusing. As far as drinks go, I had the white sangria which I had to return, it was vodka based (unflavored vodka) and tasted like orange and cranberry juice with some fruit punch and LOTS of vodka.  Def not a sangria. Other than that I had a nice experience and will return
What an awesome spot, it was lit!!! Great service and no problems. Hookah was great, drinks where good and wings where amazing nice and crunchy and just a wonderful experience for us DC people.

I must like it here because sometimes I come more than once a week.  The sticky wings are so yummy. As a regular, I appreciate that they remember that I like blue tips with my hookah.  It's the little things. :)

Amazing drinks and bites! At first we were surprised by the reservation system, but have come to really appreciate it! We love that the business offers a variety of hookah flavors. Also, the owner interacts with customers quite a bit and that in itself is appreciated.5 stars and highly recommended! :)

Went here for drinks with a few of my coworkers. We arrived at 4 p.m. when they opened, so the spot was empty. We were greeted by really pleasant waitresses. They explained to us what the Happy Hour specials were. I ordered a rum punch n it was really good! Although Happy Hour was at the bar only, the staff offered us a table where we could all be comfortable, while we still got to enjoy the Happy Hour special. We ordered food once we got to the table. My friend ordered hookah, she said it was the best she'd ever had lol. The food was delicious! I was surprised b/c I was only expecting their hookah to be great. I had a really good experience n I will definitely be returning!

I was walking by looking for a place to grab a drink with some friends. We noticed the awesome ambience in here and decided to join the fun. It was a great experience! Everything from the food (buffalo wings and sliders) to the drinks ( Chardonnay, henny and cranberry, sex on the beach and their signature 369) to the impeccable service!Our waitress was attentive and in addition the owners were impeccable. They were sure to check in on us consistently. This place is new but I am certain that it's going to be amazing. If you are nearby stop in I am certain it will not be a disappointment. Thank you to the owners Tiffany and Stephen!!!!

Chic upscale new spot in Harlem! The lounge is new and the decor is beautiful. This was my first time trying hookah, so I figured I couldn't go wrong with the pineapple flavor. They have lots of options for anyone more familiar with hookah.Menu has typical bar type food and the food was excellent. Sticky wings are a must!! Yummy! Also had the mac and cheese (plated and served 3 different ways)which was also yummy and the calamari; which was tender, not rubbery! I enjoyed the vibe of lounge and can't wait to go back. Heads up...place looks very busy, so make sure you make reservations.

Nice and smooth, great flavor (we got mint and mango) and they change the coal frequently. Shoutout to the real MVP, our bartender Shelby! She was so cool and down to earth and makes amazing drinks!
Had an amazing time at Harlem hookah last night. Great atmosphere and the bartender Shelby is the best! Drinks were strong and hookah was amazing! I will for sure be coming back!

Amazing experience- superb bartender, manager and friendly staff. Hookah was crazy good, wings were crispy, drinks were strong. If you're looking for a boring night, this isn't your place, looking for a great time to mix and mingle this is your spot!  music, drinks and food! Hookah the best! Shelby & Fany were amazing!

The vibe is amazing. Great music and great hookah. This is a great place for friends or a date. The drinks and food are tasty and so worth it on a Thursday or the weekend. Can never go wrong with Harlem Hookah.

Food is incredible.  Sunday brunch is a little loud for my liking, but the wait staff was very accommodating!  Try the Shrimp and Grits.  You won't be mad if you do!

Yes, the bouncer does hold the line at times, but has been a sweetheart to me and my friends and I never had to wait more than 15 mins to get in (even when packed).
